programme.title: The Family Man
Family Man – Eine himmlische Entscheidung
programme.desc: The Family Man: Directed by Brett Ratner. With Nicolas Cage, Téa Leoni, Don Cheadle, Jeremy Piven. A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0218967/","name":"The Family Man","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzYzMTQ4NDYtNWRkZi00NTYxLThlZDItMzI1MmU1MmU5ZWQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDA5Mjg5MjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0218967/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"whynotbacritic"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's A Wonderful Life in 2000","reviewBody":"I found this movie to be a very nice remix of "It's a Wonderful Life", much like "You've got Mail" is a remix of "Pride and Prejudice" (and totally hints at this within the film). A classic film to make you reexamine your own life, and think about what is really important and meaningful for you, what is success and happiness? Young dreamers in love with their successful careers instead of each other, find out that maybe their love really was meant to be. This is what Nicholas Cage finds out, and when he wakes up from the dream of what 'could have been', he rushes to stop 'loosing her' again, and hopefully still live the happily ever after dream. Nicholas Cage provides a stunning and comical performance in character, from the aggressive businessman - big business and small business - to a loving father and husband with his charming sense of humor. Quite a romantic film to watch with that 'someone special' during the holidays."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107083,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2001-09-12","keywords":"christmas,parallel universe,career man,reflection,crisis of conscience","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi318685465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRmZjg2MTgtN2NmMS00ODAyLTg4OWItODFlMTRiZTBmNDY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRmZjg2MTgtN2NmMS00ODAyLTg4OWItODFlMTRiZTBmNDY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000332/","name":"Don Cheadle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711840/","name":"Brett Ratner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009876/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0224606/","name":"David Diamond"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919289/","name":"David Weissman"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: New Year's Eve
Happy New Year
programme.desc:
New Year's Eve: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Michelle Pfeiffer, Zac Efron, Charlotte Marshall-Fricker, Fiona Choi. The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1598822/","name":"New Year's Eve","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2Mzg2MDQxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc3NTY5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1598822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyCollins"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too many story lines make New Years Eve a bit of a dud.","reviewBody":"I rather enjoy the odd ensemble comedy such as this film, I somewhat enjoyed Valentines Day and I really enjoyed He's Just Not That Into You, but what those film had but this doesn't is a fewer amount of plot lines. There's just too much going on in this film, far too many characters, as soon as I found myself interested in one plot its segment would end, you can never get really attached to one set of characters.

For me the best storyline was the Michelle Pfieffer and Zefron plot, it was really the only one with a bit of substance, I actually think a full movie of that story would be great, also the Jessica Biel and Seth Meyers plot was rather funny thanks to the highly underrated Ms Biel. This movie is entertaining enough I suppose but it's also lacking any real great laugh out loud moments, the only time I laughed was when Jessica Biel was in labour, she could do some great comedy if given the chance.

Lea Michele manages to bring her great screen charisma to the big screen, she is very fun to watch and her rendition of Aude Lang Syne was lovely and a nice way to end the movie.

If this movie had about four or five less stories happening this movie would have been much better, it's not horrible by any standards but it's not excellent either, also this may sound mean but Sofia Vergara is possibly the most annoying actress alive, at least they didn't put a decent actress in the most annoying role in the film. I mean it's worth paying to see the excellent dance scene between Zefron and Pfieffer over the end credits.

OK, but basically it's exactly the same as Valentines Day but with more actors and a lot less substance.

Enjoy. Maybe.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"ensemble film,new year,new year's eve,singer,expecting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi673095449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005110/","name":"Ashton Kutcher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

There's just too much going on in this film, far too many characters, as soon as I found myself interested in one plot its segment would end, you can never get really attached to one set of characters.

For me the best storyline was the Michelle Pfieffer and Zefron plot, it was really the only one with a bit of substance, I actually think a full movie of that story would be great, also the Jessica Biel and Seth Meyers plot was rather funny thanks to the highly underrated Ms Biel. This movie is entertaining enough I suppose but it's also lacking any real great laugh out loud moments, the only time I laughed was when Jessica Biel was in labour, she could do some great comedy if given the chance.

Lea Michele manages to bring her great screen charisma to the big screen, she is very fun to watch and her rendition of Aude Lang Syne was lovely and a nice way to end the movie.

If this movie had about four or five less stories happening this movie would have been much better, it's not horrible by any standards but it's not excellent either, also this may sound mean but Sofia Vergara is possibly the most annoying actress alive, at least they didn't put a decent actress in the most annoying role in the film. I mean it's worth paying to see the excellent dance scene between Zefron and Pfieffer over the end credits.

OK, but basically it's exactly the same as Valentines Day but with more actors and a lot less substance.

Enjoy. Maybe.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"ensemble film,new year,new year's eve,singer,expecting","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi673095449","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve. programme.title: Jack Frost
Jack Frost – Der coolste Dad der Welt
programme.desc:
Jack Frost: Directed by Troy Miller. With Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross, Mark Addy. A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0141109/","name":"Jack Frost","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE4YWIzNjItZWNhNi00Y2E1LTgyODktMTUzM2ZkMmJlNDFlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzYzMzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0141109/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Lee B"},"dateCreated":"2000-05-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I admit it, I cried . . .","reviewBody":"Sorry everyone, but I liked this movie. I even cried at the end. My kids freaked when the snowman started to talk and move - one of them got scared by a guy in a teddy bear suit when she was about 3, and she hasn't got over it yet (2 yrs later). They had loved the start of the movie, with the snowball fight and building the first snowman, but as soon as the second snowman came to life we had to turn the video off.

I couldn't believe in Kelly Preston as the mother of an 11-yr-old boy, but in spite of that the casting was great. And Michael Keaton with blond hair is such a hunk . . .

Give it a go!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35136,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"1998-12-11","keywords":"character name as title,two word title,movie flop,altered version of studio logo,jack frost character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Jack Frost","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3282567449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000474/","name":"Michael Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000593/","name":"Kelly Preston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189200/","name":"Joseph Cross"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003474/","name":"Troy Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0025311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425756/","name":"Mark Steven Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089237/","name":"Steve Bloom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731271/","name":"Jonathan Roberts"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Polar Express
Der Polarexpress
programme.desc:
The Polar Express: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Tom Hanks, Leslie Zemeckis, Eddie Deezen, Nona Gaye. On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338348/","name":"The Polar Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NTU0NTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sak007"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Should become a holiday classic","reviewBody":"A simple story . . . beautifully told . . . magnificently visualized.

The IMAX experience was stunning.

I did not expect to enjoy the story as much as I did. Simple but quite heartwarming.

Although it started a bit slow, it continued to gain momentum (no train analogy intended) through its conclusion. I was not a great lover of the animation of the human characters, but the other animation, whether it be the train, the scenery, the reindeer, or the elves (are elves human?) was quite well done. 

Perhaps the best review I can provide is that after I watched the Polar Express, I just felt happier.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":191455,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-12-22","keywords":"santa claus character,christmas movie,male protagonist,based on children's book,train engineer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Polar Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2954167065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy's fantastical train journey to the North Pole"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178875/","name":"Chris Coppola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005052/","name":"Michael Jeter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036807/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036575/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885575/","name":"Chris Van Allsburg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115310/","name":"William Broyles Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

Raised as an over-sized elf, a human travels from the North Pole to NYC to meet his biological father who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0319343/","name":"Elf","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUxNzkzMzQtYjIxZC00NzU0LThkYTQtZjNhNTljMTA1MDA1L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Raised as an over-sized elf, a human travels from the North Pole to NYC to meet his biological father who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0319343/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"george.schmidt"},"dateCreated":"2003-11-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"An instant holiday classic: Ferrell's crowning achievement to date!","reviewBody":"ELF (2003) *** 1/2 Will Ferrell, James Caan, Mary Steenburgen, Edward Asner, Bob Newhart, Zooey Daschanel, Daniel Tay, Amy Sedaris, Faizon Love, Andy Richter, Kyle Gass, Michael Lerner, Artie Lange, Peter Billingsley, Peter Dinklage, Claire Lautier, Jon Favreau. Ferrell gives an inspired lunacy turn as a man who was raised by elves at The North Pole and discovers to his dismay he's actually human sparking his quest to be re-united with his long-lost father (Caan in an inspired bit of casting), a 'naughty-list' occupant, who works as a children's book publisher in New York City, just in time for Christmas. Hysterically funny thanks to the goofy yet sweet and wonderful turn by Ferrell (no one else could pull off the razor's edge of looking like an idiot yet retaining the innocent glee of a child and bares a striking resemblance to Tom Hanks' turn in 'BIG') with a great cast especially the beguilingly pretty Daschanel as his fellow Santa's Little Helper at Gimbels'who he falls in love with. Directed with style and witty warmth by Favreau (who has a cameo) and written by newcomer David Berenbaum with a smart, fun script that caters to all ages with a nostalgic nod to classic animated holiday specials for good measure. An instant holiday classic. Trivia note: Billingsley, best known as Ralphie from the yuletide cinematic classic, plays 'A CHRISTMAS STORY' the elf foreman!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":245772,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-06-16","keywords":"elf,christmas,father son relationship,santa claus,christmas movie","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Elf","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4112665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI0MjU1ZjEtM2ExNS00YWJkLWJmMmMtOGIzMzM0ZTMwZWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI0MjU1ZjEtM2ExNS00YWJkLWJmMmMtOGIzMzM0ZTMwZWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001001/","name":"James Caan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0627878/","name":"Bob Newhart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269463/","name":"Jon Favreau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031707/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052918/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1183854/","name":"David Berenbaum"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: It's a Wonderful Life
Ist das Leben nicht schön?
programme.desc: It's a Wonderful Life: Directed by Frank Capra. With James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore, Thomas Mitchell. An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0038650/","name":"It's a Wonderful Life","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc4NDZhZWMtNGEzYS00ZWU2LThlM2ItNTA0YzQ0OTExMTE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwMzI2NzU@._V1_.jpg","description":"An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0038650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brianlion"},"dateCreated":"2002-11-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"IT'S NOT OFFICIALLY CHRISTMAS SEASON UNTIL I WATCH THIS MOVIE","reviewBody":"I am so glad Frank Capra had a vision to make "It's A Wonderful Life". I'm glad he chose Jimmy Stewart to play George Bailey. There are some little gems in life that help make life pleasant. It is not officially the Christmas season without watching this little gem. The supporting cast is perfectly matched. Donna Reed is wonderful as well as all the characters of the town. This would be a great movie, even if it were not in a Christmas setting. The holiday flavor makes it even more charming and memorable. A angel trying to get his wings is a little far-fetched, but Capra pulls it off. The impact of living a good life cannot be underestimated. What would life be like for your family if you had never been born? Our actions do speak loudly. In an age of 9-11, we need this movie more than ever. The values of "It's A Wonderful Life" still hold true today. Yes, I'll say it, it's a wonderful movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":427383,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1947-01-07","keywords":"alternate history,small town life,guardian angel,christmas,second chance","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It's a Wonderful Life","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1101988121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmUyMzVmNjgtMWQ1MS00OTkwLWEzMTktOTFlYmRiNmE1MWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmUyMzVmNjgtMWQ1MS00OTkwLWEzMTktOTFlYmRiNmE1MWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Artisan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000071/","name":"James Stewart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001656/","name":"Donna Reed"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000859/","name":"Lionel Barrymore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001008/","name":"Frank Capra"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0196361/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0329304/","name":"Frances Goodrich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0352443/","name":"Albert Hackett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001008/","name":"Frank Capra"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bucks tierische Entdeckungen der unglaublichen Art
programme.desc: Aus einem verschneiten Winterwald im Nordosten der USA berichtet Buck Staghorn über die Badefreuden der Makaken. Am Beispiel von Gepard und Schildkröte erklärt er die Relativität von Geschwindigkeit. 25 Min.CDN 1996. Von Sue Brophey.Ab 0 Jahre.

programme.title: Weiße Weihnachten
programme.desc: Der Klassiker mit dem weltberühmten Weihnachtslied "White Christmas": Das Wintersporthotel des pensionierten Generals Waverly (Dean Jagger) steht kurz vor der Pleite: Der Schnee bleibt aus und mit ihm die Gäste. Die ehemaligen Soldaten Bob (Bing Crosby) und Phil (Danny Kaye), mittlerweile erfolgreiche Entertainer, haben eine Idee. 115 Min.USA 1954. Von Michael Curtiz, mit Bing Crosby, Danny Kaye, Rosemary Clooney.Ab 12 Jahren.

programme.title: A December Bride
A December Bride
programme.desc:
A December Bride: Directed by David Winning. With Jessica Lowndes, Daniel Lissing, Jay Hindle, Pauline Egan. A holiday wedding brings no joy to the bride's cousin, who was literally left by the groom right at the altar. Aspiring interior designer Layla is dreading the Christmastime wedding of her cousin who's marrying Layla's ex-fiancé. Although Seth is the one responsible for introducing the bride and groom, she begrudgingly accepts his offer to be her date as she's out of options. Seth gets carried away at the reception and announces they're engaged, forcing a mortified Layla to keep up the pretense. 

What I found unrealistic was a woman steeling her cousins fiancé and expecting her cousin to forgive her. THAT WOULD NEVER HAPPEN. I also think the woman would not of attended wedding. 

Now with that out of the way do I think this was a good film? "Its Average" its pleasant enough. The films stars two people who are convincing in their roles. 

The plot moves along nicely, Everything that happens after the initial set up is 60% plausible. 

The film does entertain but the core audience for this film is going to be women. Most men will be bored. Family Safe but kids will hate this!

programme.title: Elf
Buddy – Der Weihnachtself
programme.desc: Elf: Directed by Jon Favreau. With Will Ferrell, James Caan, Bob Newhart, Ed Asner. Raised as an over-sized elf, a human travels from the North Pole to NYC to meet his biological father who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0319343/","name":"Elf","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUxNzkzMzQtYjIxZC00NzU0LThkYTQtZjNhNTljMTA1MDA1L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Raised as an over-sized elf, a human travels from the North Pole to NYC to meet his biological father who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0319343/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"george.schmidt"},"dateCreated":"2003-11-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"An instant holiday classic: Ferrell's crowning achievement to date!","reviewBody":"ELF (2003) *** 1/2 Will Ferrell, James Caan, Mary Steenburgen, Edward Asner, Bob Newhart, Zooey Daschanel, Daniel Tay, Amy Sedaris, Faizon Love, Andy Richter, Kyle Gass, Michael Lerner, Artie Lange, Peter Billingsley, Peter Dinklage, Claire Lautier, Jon Favreau. Ferrell gives an inspired lunacy turn as a man who was raised by elves at The North Pole and discovers to his dismay he's actually human sparking his quest to be re-united with his long-lost father (Caan in an inspired bit of casting), a 'naughty-list' occupant, who works as a children's book publisher in New York City, just in time for Christmas. Hysterically funny thanks to the goofy yet sweet and wonderful turn by Ferrell (no one else could pull off the razor's edge of looking like an idiot yet retaining the innocent glee of a child and bares a striking resemblance to Tom Hanks' turn in 'BIG') with a great cast especially the beguilingly pretty Daschanel as his fellow Santa's Little Helper at Gimbels'who he falls in love with. Directed with style and witty warmth by Favreau (who has a cameo) and written by newcomer David Berenbaum with a smart, fun script that caters to all ages with a nostalgic nod to classic animated holiday specials for good measure. An instant holiday classic. Trivia note: Billingsley, best known as Ralphie from the yuletide cinematic classic, plays 'A CHRISTMAS STORY' the elf foreman!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":245772,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-06-16","keywords":"elf,christmas,father son relationship,santa claus,christmas movie","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Elf","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4112665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI0MjU1ZjEtM2ExNS00YWJkLWJmMmMtOGIzMzM0ZTMwZWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI0MjU1ZjEtM2ExNS00YWJkLWJmMmMtOGIzMzM0ZTMwZWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001001/","name":"James Caan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0627878/","name":"Bob Newhart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269463/","name":"Jon Favreau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031707/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052918/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1183854/","name":"David Berenbaum"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jack Frost
Jack Frost – Der coolste Dad der Welt
programme.desc:
Jack Frost: Directed by Troy Miller. With Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross, Mark Addy. A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0141109/","name":"Jack Frost","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE4YWIzNjItZWNhNi00Y2E1LTgyODktMTUzM2ZkMmJlNDFlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzYzMzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0141109/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Lee B"},"dateCreated":"2000-05-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I admit it, I cried . . .","reviewBody":"Sorry everyone, but I liked this movie. I even cried at the end. My kids freaked when the snowman started to talk and move - one of them got scared by a guy in a teddy bear suit when she was about 3, and she hasn't got over it yet (2 yrs later). They had loved the start of the movie, with the snowball fight and building the first snowman, but as soon as the second snowman came to life we had to turn the video off.

I couldn't believe in Kelly Preston as the mother of an 11-yr-old boy, but in spite of that the casting was great. And Michael Keaton with blond hair is such a hunk . . .

Give it a go!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35136,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"1998-12-11","keywords":"character name as title,two word title,movie flop,altered version of studio logo,jack frost character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Jack Frost","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3282567449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000474/","name":"Michael Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000593/","name":"Kelly Preston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189200/","name":"Joseph Cross"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003474/","name":"Troy Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0025311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425756/","name":"Mark Steven Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089237/","name":"Steve Bloom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731271/","name":"Jonathan Roberts"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Happiest Season

programme.desc: Happiest Season: Directed by Clea DuVall. With Kristen Stewart, Mackenzie Davis, Mary Steenburgen, Victor Garber. programme.title: Arthur Christmas
Arthur Weihnachtsmann
programme.desc:
Arthur Christmas: Directed by Sarah Smith, Barry Cook. With James McAvoy, Hugh Laurie, Bill Nighy, Jim Broadbent. Santa's clumsy son Arthur sets out on a mission with Grandsanta to give out a present they misplaced to a young girl in less than two hours." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1430607/","name":"Arthur Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY4Njk5OGQtZGMzYS00NmRhLTgxMzMtYzE0YzE1MDg4NDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA4NjE0NjEy._V1_.jpg","description":"Santa's clumsy son Arthur sets out on a mission with Grandsanta to give out a present they misplaced to a young girl in less than two hours.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1430607/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Scrooge-3"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Delightfully charming","reviewBody":"Arthur Claus (James McAvoy) is the bumbling son of the reigning Santa, Malcolm Claus (Jim Broadbent). Arthur is relegated to the Letter Department where he can presumably do no damage. Arthur's brother Steve (Hugh Laurie) is the heir apparent to the title of Santa. Steve is handsome, confident, and in charge of the North Pole command center that monitors Santa's gift-giving flight around the world. The film opens with a bravura set piece showing how Santa is able to stop in millions of homes in one night. Hint: he has the help of thousands of elves. 

When Arthur discovers that one gift was accidentally undelivered, he becomes determined to get it to the unfortunate girl before Christmas sunrise. Even with the help of his retired grandsanta (Bill Nighy) and a perky elf (Ashley Jensen) from the Wrapping Department, can Arthur travel around the world in time?

There have been many movies over the years where Christmas must be saved from disaster, but Arthur Christmas has a very creative take on it. From the opening scene where it's established that Santa is really a dynasty through the centuries, a title handed down from father to son, to the paramilitary operation to get millions of presents delivered in one night, to the misadventures of Arthur and his grandsanta as they try to make sure one little girl is not disappointed, Arthur Christmas is fun, creative, and original. Produced by Aardman Animations in association with Sony Pictures Animation, this CGI animated film delivers Aardman's distinct brand of quirky humor and style. 

The art direction maintains the slightly skewed look of an Aardman claymation film. The character designs are asymmetric and the surface textures are realistic yet bold. The North Pole command center and Santa's high-tech sleigh are clean and modern. 

Sometimes celebrity voice talent backfires, but here it works beautifully, the English accents lending a sense of gravity that heightens the silliness. Bill Nighy is particularly good, conveying wisdom that is tinged with resentment of the modern gift-delivery methods his son and grandson use. 

Arthur Christmas is a funny, heartwarming, and poignant look at the Santa Claus mythos, adding a family dynamic that will resonate with children and adults. I expect Arthur Christmas will become a joyful holiday favorite for years to come.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":54952,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-11-11","keywords":"christmas,elf,christmas eve,resentment,santa claus","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677710361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3ODQzNjA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODM5OTc4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3ODQzNjA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODM5OTc4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas night at the North Pole, Santa's youngest son looks to use his father's high-tech operation for an urgent mission. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564215/","name":"James McAvoy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000980/","name":"Jim Broadbent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809877/","name":"Sarah Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176905/","name":"Barry Cook"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103531/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121181/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063165/","name":"Peter Baynham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809877/","name":"Sarah Smith"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
Schöne Bescherung
programme.desc:
National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation: Directed by Jeremiah S. Chechik. With Chevy Chase, Beverly D'Angelo, Juliette Lewis, Johnny Galecki. The Griswold family's plans for a big family Christmas predictably turn into a big disaster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097958/","name":"National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGZkMWQ2MzMtYTkxYS00OThmLWI0ZTQtNmY0ZTkyY2E4MjliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Griswold family's plans for a big family Christmas predictably turn into a big disaster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097958/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dee.reid"},"dateCreated":"2002-01-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny, Funny, Funny","reviewBody":"This is the one Christmas movie that I don't anyone can ever get tired of. Chevy Chase returns in the third installment of the Vacation series as Clarke W. Griswold as he tries desperately to maintain his sanity during the holidays with all of his relatives coming to stay under his roof and enduring all the mishaps along the way.

This is the funniest film in the series plain and simple. Chevy Chase has never been better. Christmas Vacation is filled with countless jokes and gags that it's impossible not to laugh.

programme.title: Gremlins
Gremlins – Kleine Monster
programme.desc: Gremlins: Directed by Joe Dante. With Hoyt Axton, John Louie, Keye Luke, Don Steele. A young man inadvertently breaks three important rules concerning his new pet and unleashes a horde of malevolently mischievous monsters on a small town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0087363/","name":"Gremlins","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDVjN2FkYTQtNTBlOC00MjM5LTgzMWEtZWRlNGUyYmNiOTFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man inadvertently breaks three important rules concerning his new pet and unleashes a horde of malevolently mischievous monsters on a small town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087363/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tymooda11"},"dateCreated":"2017-01-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"What a blast!","reviewBody":"Joe Dante's "Gremlins" is an absolutely, amazingly fun time. The concept of the Gremlins themselves being so intriguing and fun, and face it, Gizmo is one of the cutest creatures in cinema history. While this movies first 20 minutes are a bit boring, once the story and absolute fun insanity begins you'll be having such a good time that the run time of the film will completely slip by. I have loved this film since a young age, and sure it may be nostalgia, but god do I really love this movie. I highly recommend watching this on a cold winter night, with hot chocolate, and a warm bowl of popcorn. I guarantee that you will have a fun time with this. It's not a thought provoking film, it won't change your life, but it is a fun ride , completely worth it's length","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":211595,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"1984-06-08","keywords":"chinatown,1980s,christmas,monster,gift","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Gremlins","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2626338585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYwZmFlNTAtY2RkMi00MWQ2LThmMjUtMjgwZmQyMzA1NjMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYwZmFlNTAtY2RkMi00MWQ2LThmMjUtMjgwZmQyMzA1NjMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Original Theatrical Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002090/","name":"Zach Galligan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000121/","name":"Phoebe Cates"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001924/","name":"Hoyt Axton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001102/","name":"Joe Dante"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: New Year's Eve
Happy New Year
programme.desc:
New Year's Eve: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Michelle Pfeiffer, Zac Efron, Charlotte Marshall-Fricker, Fiona Choi. The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1598822/","name":"New Year's Eve","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2Mzg2MDQxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc3NTY5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1598822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyCollins"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too many story lines make New Years Eve a bit of a dud.","reviewBody":"I rather enjoy the odd ensemble comedy such as this film, I somewhat enjoyed Valentines Day and I really enjoyed He's Just Not That Into You, but what those film had but this doesn't is a fewer amount of plot lines. There's just too much going on in this film, far too many characters, as soon as I found myself interested in one plot its segment would end, you can never get really attached to one set of characters.

For me the best storyline was the Michelle Pfieffer and Zefron plot, it was really the only one with a bit of substance, I actually think a full movie of that story would be great, also the Jessica Biel and Seth Meyers plot was rather funny thanks to the highly underrated Ms Biel. This movie is entertaining enough I suppose but it's also lacking any real great laugh out loud moments, the only time I laughed was when Jessica Biel was in labour, she could do some great comedy if given the chance.

Lea Michele manages to bring her great screen charisma to the big screen, she is very fun to watch and her rendition of Aude Lang Syne was lovely and a nice way to end the movie.

If this movie had about four or five less stories happening this movie would have been much better, it's not horrible by any standards but it's not excellent either, also this may sound mean but Sofia Vergara is possibly the most annoying actress alive, at least they didn't put a decent actress in the most annoying role in the film. I mean it's worth paying to see the excellent dance scene between Zefron and Pfieffer over the end credits.

OK, but basically it's exactly the same as Valentines Day but with more actors and a lot less substance.

Enjoy. Maybe.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"ensemble film,new year,new year's eve,singer,expecting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi673095449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve. programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0120912, Title: Men in Black II, --- Description: Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott","dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"],"duration":"PT1H28M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black 3
Men in Black 3
programme.desc:
Men in Black 3: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, Jemaine Clement. Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1409024/","name":"Men in Black 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTYxODcwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NDY0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1409024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"3xHCCH"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Josh Brolin Played a Perfect Tommy Lee Jones","reviewBody":"I am not exactly a Will Smith fan. I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. programme.desc: The Witches of Eastwick: Directed by George Miller. With Jack Nicholson, Cher, Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer. Three single women in a picturesque village have their wishes granted, at a cost, when a mysterious and flamboyant man arrives in their lives." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0094332/","name":"The Witches of Eastwick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4ZGRlNDEtNDliMi00NmI0LThlYjctYmViMjI0MDlmOWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three single women in a picturesque village have their wishes granted, at a cost, when a mysterious and flamboyant man arrives in their lives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0094332/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"smatysia"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"What fun Nicholson must have had with this!","reviewBody":"What fun Nicholson must have had with this! programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
Hot Tub – Der Whirlpool ... ist 'ne verdammte Zeitmaschine!
programme.desc: Hot Tub Time Machine: Directed by Steve Pink. With John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson, Rob Corddry. A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1231587/","name":"Hot Tub Time Machine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwMjExODA4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTYwMDYxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1231587/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Back in time","reviewBody":"Not an instant classic, but a lot of fun to watch. I think you can summarize it like that. The main actors are doing a great job selling the very silly idea of time traveling with or rather inside a hot tub! If you get sucked into that, everything else will work too. But if you don't like that general idea ... Maybe you shouldn't watch the movie after all and save yourself the time (and grief).\n\nIt's hilarious and it has heart, even when it's gross at times. Which it can be, but it's easy to tolerate and forgive it for those little moments, because it actually is funny. Trying to figure out how it actually works (the physics of the time travel) would probably lead into a territory the movie would not want you to go ... and why would you want to ruin your own enjoyment ... if you're having fun watching - stick with it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168749,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2010-03-26","keywords":"bare breasts,ski resort,cheating wife,promiscuous woman,casual sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hot Tub Time Machine: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1318257689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjA0MDY4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA3NjYwMw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjA0MDY4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA3NjYwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four guys travel back to their respective 80s heydays thanks to a time-bending hot tub."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000131/","name":"John Cusack"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1117791/","name":"Rob Corddry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0732497/","name":"Craig Robinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684336/","name":"Steve Pink"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079035/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372222/","name":"Josh Heald"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890845/","name":"Sean Anders"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1898234/","name":"John Morris"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1231587/","name":"Hot Tub Time Machine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwMjExODA4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTYwMDYxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1231587/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp","dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Back in time","reviewBody":"Not an instant classic, but a lot of fun to watch. I think you can summarize it like that. The main actors are doing a great job selling the very silly idea of time traveling with or rather inside a hot tub! If you get sucked into that, everything else will work too. But if you don't like that general idea ... Maybe you shouldn't watch the movie after all and save yourself the time (and grief).\n\nIt's hilarious and it has heart, even when it's gross at times. Which it can be, but it's easy to tolerate and forgive it for those little moments, because it actually is funny. programme.title: Men in Black
MIB – Men In Black
programme.desc: Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crowrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.","reviewBody":"As my one line summary says, this is one of the best sci-fi comedies ever made, next to the classic Ghostbusters and the highly underrated Evolution. This movie has action, comedy, and some of the best special effects in the last ten years. Rick Baker, Hollywood's resident 'creature man', as I like to call him, has made such a wide variety of aliens. There's the first alien we see, Mikey; there's the Worm Guys; and the villanous Bug. But there are many others, such as Frank the Pug and the twins. The squid baby is pretty neat. Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith have an undeniable chemistry together, which repeats itself in the sequel. Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black 3
Men in Black 3
programme.desc:
Men in Black 3: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, Jemaine Clement. Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1409024/","name":"Men in Black 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTYxODcwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NDY0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1409024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"3xHCCH"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Josh Brolin Played a Perfect Tommy Lee Jones","reviewBody":"I am not exactly a Will Smith fan. I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="
